page.title: 04E. CHARMINSTER - FARMING 1
page.content: The land is predominantly chalk, and the sheep farming of the lusher river valley meadows has given way to arable farming. Wheat, durum wheat and barley are the main crops, interspersed with fields for hay and silage. There is an occasional field of oil seed rape and sugar beet, but they don't appear to thrive in this area. There is a large grain dryer just past Wolfeton Eweleaze, and this services many farms over a large area. One or two farms have a small dairy herd, usually Friesians, and one herd of Aberdeen Angus is the only evidence of beef production. An interesting{sideline}on one farm is an apiary, with Dorset honey being produced and sold by the family.
